calGUI

Class AddView

  • java.lang.Object
    • calGUI.AddView

  • public class AddView
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Stephen Fulton, Shawn Parkes, and Rebekah Manweiler

    AddView Class

    Displays options for the user when creating a new event for the current day

        initializes the AddView frame

      • fillBoxes

        public static void fillBoxes(javax.swing.JComboBox monthBox,
             javax.swing.JComboBox dayBox)

        This method will first update the monthBox with available months for the multi day selection and then call the updateDays method to update the dayBox

        Parameters:
        monthBox - - JComboBox: the monthList combo box that will be updated
        dayBox - - JComboBox: the dayList combo box that will be updated

      • calculateEndDate

        public static int calculateEndDate(java.lang.String month,
                   int day)

        This method will calculate the end date based on the user's selected options from the month and day combo boxes.

        Parameters:
        month - - String: Name of the selected month
        day - - Int: Index of date within month
        Returns:
        new calculated end date

      • updateDays

        public static void updateDays(javax.swing.JComboBox dayBox,
              java.lang.String month)

        This method will update the dayBox combo box based on the currently selected month

        Parameters:
        dayBox - - JComboBox: the dayList combo box that will be updated
        month - - String: the month that will determine how many days are in the dayBox

      • writeEvent

        private static void writeEvent(int date,
              int enddate,
              java.lang.String modifier,
              java.lang.String event)

        This method calls the CalFile.CalWrite method for each day that contains the event. For example, a weekly event occurs on the current day and every 7 days after until the enddate is reached, and for each of those days CalWrite is called to write the event to the file for that day.

        Parameters:
        date - - int: the current(starting) date
        enddate - - int: the last day included in the event time range
        modifier - - String: the type of event chosen (single, multiday, weekly, biweekly, monthly)
        event - - String: the comment/detail associated with the event
        Since:
        10/10/2016
